title: DriSMo
comment: Far too sensitive. Slightest pot hole amd its in the red. Does the same with speed bumps. Good idea though. Turn down sensitivity and it would be a 5

title: Great for smooth driving
comment: Recommend for friends who drive recklessly.

title: Great driving app.
comment: The sensitivity is a bit judgmental. Apparently I accelerate too quickly! ... in my car!  It does encourage economical driving though, which is good for fuel economy.

title: Beyond useless
comment: According to this app I am a bad driver no matter what I do to drive carefully. Hit a small tiny bump I'm a bad driver go round  a slight bend I'm a bad driver slow down for a junction I'm a bad driver. Unless I drive at 2 mph I get nothing but bad all the time what a waste of time

title: Unuseless
comment: Speed, acceleration - nothing matters. If you are moving, you are in Bad sector.

title: Worth persevering
comment: When it says bad driving when you're stationary, you could be tempted to uninstall it. Reducing vibration in the phone holder can transform you from a very bad driver to a very good driver.
t size t tr ttttt t sh ttrttteti ttsizert

title: Not very good at all
comment: Driving on a straight highway and am told  by app that i am bad driver!!! Really!?

title: Fun but useless
comment: The results are so inaccurate that it's funny! It goes in the red for no real reasons, bump in the road gravels, corner, etc... The only time it goes into the good driving zone is when you're standing still at a traffic light. But in another hand it can help you saving fuel driving smoothly.

title: Slow =/= skilled
comment: Be nice if I could set for performance driving instead of gas saving. At least now I know one reason other drivers take several miles to get up to the speed limit.  "Show off your skills"? Seriously? Only using the first 10% of the throttle is hardly a skill.

title: Exvellent
comment: It is very use

title: Good idea but it needs some fixes
comment: It is too sensitive on bump on the road. When you are stuck in a traffic jam it is rated as excelent driving and it improves the overal statistics which is not relevant.

title: Drismo driver skill app.
comment: Cool.

title: Don't bother!
comment: The results are more about how rough the road surface is than your driving. Apparently if you don't move - that's excellent driving?! Go up a hill - BAD! Go over a pot hole - BAD! Pull off from stationary - BAD! Avoid crashing by turning to go round a bend (Even ridiculously slowly) - BAD!

title: Brilliant
comment: I have tried a few similar apps and none of them were as good as this. It is easy to use.  Good useful feedback to improve driving skills. Only slight criticism is that speed bump/ potholes are registered as 'bad driving'.

title: Useless
comment: Kind of useless because bumps in the road set it off and make it jump to saying you're a bad driver.

title: Poor
comment: Driving steadily, smoothly and within speed limit it did nothing but tell me how bad I was. Quite funny, but ultimately useless.

title: Excellent
comment: Great way to test how smooth a driver you are and also improve fuel consumption by driving smoo ther
Very good

title: Too sensitive
comment: Great app but you can end up with a bad driving mark just because of small dents or raises in the road which are unavoidable and don't feel that bad.

title: Nice app!
comment: I have only done about 20 miles using this app. But it seems to do everything it claims, and it does it all rather well. Nice

title: Complete waste of time
comment: As a member of the Institute of Advanced Motorists, I want to find a program to monitor my driving. Unfortunately this is far from being it. It confuses bad road surfaces with bad driving. Driving up or down steep hills gives you a negative score and anything over a medium acceleration puts you in the red again. Taking a corner at more than 5 miles an hour gets you in the red too. Maybe this works well in suburban environments with perfect road surfaces in a car with incredibly soft suspension but in the UK countryside, forget it. If you really want to know how well you drive, talk to the IAM or ROSPA, this app is useless. (Phone is a stock galaxy S3. Test vehicle Daewoo Musso over 52.5 miles and Nissan Primera over 31.4 miles).
Bad driving for steady 20mph.... Yeah right

title: Rates road surface, not driving
comment: Like many others have said, this is a great app for rating the condition of the road surface, but does nothing to rate the quality of your driving. Sitting at a light, I'm an excellent driver, but once I start moving in rate as bad! Even on the highway with cruise on, the road bumps make the rating bad. Get real!

title: Don't bother
comment: Useless app, even sticking to speed limits and under can't get it to show good driving, only time it does is when I stop as soon as the car starts moving again dial goes back down to bad driving, try the go compare app instead no active display of driving but gives a score after journey, seems far more accurate than this app, now off to delete it.

title: Excellent app.
comment: Does what it says very well. Took one star off, cause' still asks me to rate it after I allready have done it.

title: Not very useful
comment: There is no correlation between the quality of the driving and the rating by the application.

title: Great idea let down by UK roads
comment: Agree with other reviewers - far too sensitive to potholes and other road conditions. I've just driven to work, within speed limits, in cruise, gearbox braking with minimal foot brake use and slowing for corners. 19% bad, 79% ok, 2% good. I'd love to know how you can get it to register excellent! I'm sure tweaks could solve this, maybe the calibration is too severe....

title: Bumps make you a Bad Driver
comment: Driving a lifted vehicle on large tires:  every bump in the road = Bad Driver.  You would think it would measure aggressive speed, braking, erratic movements, etc, using gps..   Decent theory, just not for my on-road, off-road type vehicle.

title: Quite Underwhelmed
comment: This only shows a dial and it talks occasionally. I could not download data or get more details. I deleted it after a 20 minute trial.

title: Good try
comment: But let down, on my Galaxy Ace, by bumps in the road swamping the horizontal accelerations which are the real signal of driving style. Great way of logging the quality of the road surface!

title: Not
comment: Worth a hoot here in my back county roads in N.Ireland. Had me in red all the way cause road is up and down like a yo yo.
Great app

title: Comedy app
comment: Having used this on the Nordschliefe and clocking a 9.17 this app told me my epic driving was 'bad' so the lower the score...the better the driver ;)

title: Interesting application, needs calibration
comment: The app is very interesting but needs calibration of the thresholds. Every bump is sensed in yellow or red when even my pregnant wife doesn't feel uncomfortable. Too sensitive for Indian roads.

title: GOOD GAME
comment: But make new version of it...it will rock trust mE...

title: K
comment: Rubbish app. Picks up all bumps in road and constantly reads bad driving

title: Good, but...
comment: Very nice app. But unless the pothole and speed-breaker aspect is taken care of, it's useless in a country like India. I did my best driving on a non-congested road and still came up 'Okay' thanks to the potholes. I hope you guys find a solution to that soon.

title: Love it!!!
comment: Helps my wife to learn driving.
Please let users without data connection plan could download map data separately via wi-fi.

title: Needs bug fixing
comment: As other people said, vertical acceleration has to be mostly ignored. Can't I see previous runs on the map?

title: Gimmick
comment: Not a proper driving monitor, just a gimmicky app that requires a totally smooth road surface and no stopping at lights to even hint at being accurate in any way.   The search for a fuel saving driving style moderating app goes on.

title: Needs sensitivity buffering
comment: Does a great job at what it's advertised to do. Five stars requires sensitivity option / buffering of sensor data and possible exclusion of bad data (impossible spike). Not all cars have soft suspension, and not all roads are perfect. Perhaps predefined options - 4x4 (quick buffer), regular, and sports (slow buffer to compensate for harder suspension). This app as is is great for measuring passenger comfort.

title: What does it measure?
comment: It seems the app measures road surface conditions and the quality of the vehicle's suspension, more than anything else. In RSA, both are well below par... The app seems to be totally oblivious of one's driving prowess.

title: Great for the oldies.
comment: Far to sensitive. I rate myself as a fairly decent driver, every bump in the road I went over apparently made me a bad driver and every time I stopped at lights made me an excellent driver. This is for the old bids that drive around at 20mph the 1's that cause the accidents because people try to avoid there so called good driving.

title: Smp
comment: Some times it dose not switch off and is affected by the road surface

title: Good
comment: Excellent.i like dis app

title: No Offramp
comment: Without an Exit button or some other way to kill the process manually, I don't want it.

title: Not bad!
comment: I love the couple of laughs it gave me when it commented on how well or painful my driving was as I drove. It crashes sometimes but not sure if it's just my phone's set up. I would like the option of a quick start upon taping a widget for example using a previous calibration setting. This is a great app for testing your driving skills and for those complaining about it being too sensitive, that could be just your phone, you're just not driving well enough, or you worry too much. Look for overall average.

title: Droid Bionic
comment: Perfect for the drunk driver!

title: DrisMo
comment: Cool
Nice

title: No
comment: Living in a valey this is a bad idea it says nothing but bad lol

title: Yuck
comment: Not very helpful at all. Little bumps in the road make it go bad.

title: Great to practice smooth driving
comment: Mostly accurate as long as phone is kept still.  Voice can be irritating after a while

title: Drismo
comment: Good app. I try to get the best score which also saves me fuel and ware on my vehicle.

title: Not viewable by MOBILE  onYouTube !?
comment: Dude U forgot to make the YouTubeVideo  of this viewable on MOBILE Devices! Come on man, it's a MOBILE APP!! remember?!  & sorry...Fun but useless.

title: Good but u need ro update somw flaws
comment: It works great on newly paved roads but whenever you go over a hill, hit a bump or come to a stop it goes straight to the red. It needs to recognize the stops for sure

title: So far, useless crap
comment: It does not distinct a hill from acceleration, bumpy roads generates thousands of warnings etc. And the final score is completely funny, useless.

title: It was fun
comment: Fun to use!

title: Gr8
comment: Great app ..... Try it for yourself :)
Bumpy road makes you a bad driver

title: Works well, fun too. Ssg2
comment: Provides very good feed back of your drive. Overly sensitive to bumps and acceleration imo. Probably a device issue though. Thanks to dev for no ads!
Absolutely brilliant. Great stats I can use. Accurate mapping and helpful trainer. Just brill!

title: Useful.
comment: Tested the app while driving a bus around the suburbs of Stockholm, SE. I managed to get the verdict "good". What pushed the verdict down was road bumps and damages which I simply could not avoid, while the vehicle is rather large. I couldn't drive any slower because I would have been late. The voice comments while driving is touching, sort of ;-)

title: Not really that good
comment: Way too sensitive. Sharp turns throw me to the yellow even at 10 kph, and speed bumps? Well, you're just unlucky.

title: Too sensitive
comment: Too sensitive, even when still and engine off (stop & start car system) it deviates into "bad driver" (htc desire). Good idea though.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Smart app. Interesting to follow up my driving skills improve by being more aware.

title: Nice app. Needs some improvements
comment: It really helps to by a smooth driver. I have problem running it in the background. It records only between 5 and 10 minutes and there is not indication it is no longer running. In the foreground seems to work OK though. I use it together with SmoothDrive. This is better but it lacks the live feedback.

title: fun way to improve driving
comment: works well on zte blade
Good but not great. Speed bumps send me into the red no matter how slow I drive. Nice UI, could do with being able to choose driver.

title: DriSMo
comment: Works great. Helps me keep my agressive driving more moderate.

title: Pretty good
comment: Some interesting results.  Australia, samsung galaxy 2

title: Good but can be better
comment: Nice application, but somehow must be calibrated to the vehicle engine rotations/min or fuel consumption. Obd2 interface would be great

title: Pretty cool -
comment: Works well. Meter jumps around on bumpy roads giving me a poor rating. Pretty nifty app though.
Makes you think about your driving habits
This app is good, very critical of your driving if phone is not securely mounted but gives you the ability to compete against yourself with each trip

title: Decent App.
comment: It really makes you conscious of how easy you are on the car. Well made, but I wish it had ongoing calibration. It would smooth out the data on hills.

title: Vibration and bumps
comment: Says my girlfriend is a better driver than me, must be broken X-D. But seriously, it doesn't seem to accept vibration and bumps well.
There is no way this can judge how good of a driver you are if when you are driving across rough roads it says your a bad driver.

title: Interesting, but....
comment: I don't think I deserve a lowered score for driving up hill. Clever application idea, though. Keep it up.

title: Sucks
comment: Gives you a poor score with bumps on the road
Completely useless for my little four wheel drive Suzuki. Considers every bump to be bad driving, which makes for a lot of supposedly "bad" driving.
Very nice app that encoyrages safe driving.
Does what it says on the tin. Use it to improve your driving skill for smooth and economical driving. Nice one guys.
I was walking and it told me i am a bad driver...what a joke.
Cool stuff. Defenately worth trying and useful to settle a difference. Easy to use/calibrate. Just wish i could get to tthe csv files
Update works great now! Thanks for addressing the sensor issue.
Good concept. Would give better result if being stationary was recorded as such and not as excellent driving.
